business.headline: End of the road for BluSmart as Sebi exposes Gensol fraudMany users across Delhi-NCR, Bengaluru, and Mumbai reported that they could no longer book rides through the BluSmart app. The company also sent a notification to users stating that bookings were being temporarily closed.

Infosys Q4 results today: All eyes on FY26 outlook, dividend detailsInfosys Q4FY25 results: As the second-largest software services exporter gears up to release its earnings, investors will be watching closely for guidance on FY26 revenue growth, margins, and management's take on business sentiment in key markets.

Gensol Engineering shares hit 5% lower circuit for 2nd straight dayGensol Engineering share price: The stock plunged 5% to Rs 117.50 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), hitting yet another all-time low.

Explained: Why Nvidia's market value dropped $148 billion overnightNvidia shares were hit hard in the overnight trading session on Wall Street, falling nearly 7% and losing $148 billion in market value.

Wipro shares tank 6% in early trade despite strong Q4 earnings. Buy or sell?Wipro share price: At 9:20 am, Wipro shares were trading 5.33% lower at Rs 234.30 on the Bombay Stock Exchange. The decline came after the company reported its earnings post-market hours on Wednesday.

Sensex loses over 300 points in early trade, Nifty below 23,400; Wipro down 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 344.50 points to 76,700.24, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 119.70 points to 23,317.50 as of 9:30 am.

Rio Tinto partners with Indian firm to explore low-carbon aluminium projectThe potential development could see up to 1 million tonnes per annum (mtpa) of primary aluminium smelting and 2 mtpa of alumina production, both energized by renewable wind and solar power, supported by pumped hydro storage, the global miner said.

Stock market opening today: Sensex, Nifty likely to open lower. Here's whyDespite the weak outlook for Thursday's session, Sensex and Nifty have seen a strong upward trend in the last few days. In the past three sessions, Nifty50 has gone up by 4.6% while Sensex has gained 4.3%.

Stocks to watch on April 17: Wipro, Gensol, Tata Steel, BEL, Paytm, Hero MotoCorpSeveral companies will announce their results for Q4 FY25 on Thursday. These include Infosys, HDFC Life Insurance Company, Jio Financial Services, HDFC Asset Management Company, Tata Elxsi, National Standard (India), and E2E Networks.

TCS gets 21 acres in Visakhapatnam for just 99 paisa as Andhra bets big on techThe cabinet of Andhra Pradesh cleared the proposal on Tuesday, stating that the project is expected to bring in an investment of around Rs 1,370 crore and create nearly 12,000 jobs.

Old or New Tax Regime: Here's how to pick the right one before filing ITRUnder the old tax regime, taxpayers can claim various deductions and exemptions, while the new tax regime does not offer much deductions.

ITR filing: How is tax refund calculated, and when will you get it?When you file your return, you declare your income, claim deductions, and report taxes already paid. The tax system compares your actual tax due with what you've already paid. If you've paid more, the extra amount is returned to you as a refund.

entertainment.headline: The Royals: Ishaan Khatter, Bhumi Pednekar's coming-of-age drama to release in MayIshaan Khatter and Bhumi Pednekar's upcoming series, 'The Royals', is set to premiere on Netflix on May 9. The makers announced the date with a poster.

Logout review: Babil Khan gets likes, followers and chaos in tech thrillerReleased-Fri Apr 18, 2025Babil Khan's 'Logout' will stream on Zee5 from April 18 onwards. The thriller offers a chilling commentary on digital obsession and the following psychological unraveling. Read our review.

Shahid Kapoor wows with 'Shaandaar' performance at event, KJo and Sushmita joinBollywood star Shahid Kapoor made a memorable appearance at Seema Singh's daughter's sangeet ceremony last night. He entertained the guests with his dance moves to 'Mauja Hi Mauja' and singing 'Shaam Shaandaar'.

Jaat box office Day 7: Sunny Deol gets 3rd biggest film of his career after GadarSunny Deol's 'Jaat' is already the third highest-grossing film of his career after 'Gadar' and 'Gadar 2'. The film is currently running decently in theatres with its seven-day business in the range of Rs 57 crore nett.

Kajol and Malaika Arora's heartwarming hug at Mumbai event wins InternetAt a recent Mumbai event, Bollywood stars Kajol and Malaika Arora shared a warm embrace, capturing the attention of fans and media alike. The duo's chemistry was the highlight of the evening, as fans couldn't stop gushing over the moment.

Apoorva Mukhija hints at vacating Mumbai home after India's Got Latent rowInfluencer and actor Apoorva Mukhija seemed to have moved out of her Mumbai house, months after India's Got Latent controversy. She shared a short video giving a glimpse of the empty house.

Picture abhi baki hai: Ranveer Allahbadia says 'brother' Samay Raina will be backRanveer Allahbadia conducted an 'Ask Me Anything' session on Instagram addressing the India's Got Latent controversy and the events that followed. He revealed stronger ties with Samay Raina and support for Ashish Chanchlani and Apoorva Mukhija.

Prithviraj and Malayalam celebs honoured at Kerala State Film Awards presentationChief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan presented Kerala State Film Awards (2023) in Thiruvananthapuram on Wednesday. Prithviraj Sukumaran, Urvashi and many others were honoured for their exceptional work.

Anurag Kashyap slams Brahmin outfits opposing Phule, calls out rigged systemAnurag Kashyap criticised Brahminical groups for opposing Hindi film 'Phule', highlighting issues of casteism and a compromised system. He questioned the access that fringe groups have to unreleased films and called out censorship practices.

Vijay Sethupathi reflects on working with director Puri JagannadhVijay Sethupathi recently shared his excitement about collaborating with director Puri Jagannadh. On being asked about the collaboration, he said it was the story that convinced him, not the filmmaker's past track record.
Stand-up comedian Nate Bargatze to host Emmys 2025Stand-up comedian Nate Bargatze will host the 77th Emmy Awards, live from Los Angeles. The event will take place on September 15 IST.

Citadel spin-offs cancelled, to merge storylines into main seriesPrime Video has decided not to continue with 'Citadel' spinoffs 'Honey Bunny' and 'Diana' as standalone series. Instead, their storylines will be integrated into the second season of 'Citadel', set for a global release in 2026.

Lebanon bans Disney's Snow White over Gal Gadot's support for IsraelLebanon has prohibited the screening of Disney's 'Snow White' due to the casting of Israeli actor Gal Gadot. The ban aligns with the country's ongoing boycott of Israeli artists amid regional tensions.

Actor Nazriya Nazim Fahadh 'struggling with emotional well-being': I shut downNazriya Nazim Fahadh opened up about her recent absence from the public eye, explaining that it was due to struggles with emotional well-being. She also extended her apologies and gratitude to her friends and supporters.

Pooja Hegde on break from Telugu films: Felt like a missing childPooja Hegde recently talked about why she has stayed away from Telugu films. She also spoke about her upcoming projects, and her return to Tollywood.

SS Rajamouli recalls Jr NTR's Komuram Bheemudo shoot in RRR: Tarak was possessed'RRR' director SS Rajamouli, who was in Japan to promote his Netflix documentary 'RRR: Behind and Beyond', praised Jr NTR's performance in the song 'Komuram Bheemudo', while interacting with the media.

Rohit Shetty, John Abraham join hands for Rakesh Maria's biopicJohn Abraham and Rohit Shetty are joining hands for a new film inspired by Rakesh Maria's life. The project will explore Maria's illustrious career in the Mumbai Police.

Radhika Apte to join Tabu and Vijay Sethupathi in Puri Jagannadh's next: ReportAfter years away from Telugu cinema, Radhika Apte is reportedly reuniting with filmmaker Puri Jagannadh for an intense pan-India project, also starring Vijay Sethupathi and Tabu.

Eddington teaser: Joaquin Phoenix, Pedro Pascal clash in Ari Aster's black comedyThe teaser of Ari Aster's latest film, 'Eddington', released on April 15. A black comedy, Eddington is set to premiere at the 2025 Cannes Film Festival.

general news.headline: We are different from Hindus: Pak Army chief invokes Two-Nation TheoryPakistan's Army chief, General Asim Munir, has urged Pakistanis to pass down the ideology that led to the creation of the Islamic Republic. In a public speech, Munir doubled down on the differences between Hindus and Muslims, as he invoked the Two-Nation Theory, the cornerstone of Pakistan's creation and identity.

Team India's batting, fielding coaches sacked after Australia series debacleThe Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) has removed assistant coach Abhishek Nayar, along with fielding coach T. Dilip and strength and conditioning coach Soham Desai, from their roles after India's 1-3 series loss in Australia.

No protection for those marrying against parents' wish: Allahabad High CourtThe Allahabad High Court ruled that couples marrying against their parents' wishes cannot demand police protection as a right unless there's a real threat to their safety.

Harvard may lose ability to enroll foreign students if...: Trump's big warningThe Trump administration has warned Harvard University to accept its new policy or risk losing the ability to enroll foreign students.

Maharashtra okays new education policy, Hindi made compulsory third languageA major component of this plan is the introduction of Hindi as a compulsory third language for students in Classes 1 to 5 studying in Marathi and English medium schools.

Anurag Kashyap slams Brahmin outfits opposing Phule, calls out rigged systemAnurag Kashyap criticised Brahminical groups for opposing Hindi film 'Phule', highlighting issues of casteism and a compromised system. He questioned the access that fringe groups have to unreleased films and called out censorship practices.

Why you can bet big on Haryana's Hisar, ready for take-off with a new airportA new airport isn't just bringing regional connectivity to Hisar, it is galvanising the steel city for a big leap into the future. Matching the Centre's big plans for Hisar as a defence-manufacturing and aviation-sector hub, Haryana itself is moving to put Hisar as a counter-magnet city outside the NCR.

Trump, Musk, Yunus among Time's 100 most influential people, no Indian in listTime magazine has released the 2025 edition of the 100 most influential people in the world, featuring prominent world leaders, including US President Donald Trump and Bangladesh's Chief Advisor Muhammad Yunus. However, no Indian was found in the list.

Fatwa against actor Vijay for controversial iftar party: He invited alcoholicsA Muslim cleric from Uttar Pradesh issued a fatwa against actor-politician Thalapathy Vijay. The Sunni ulema accused the Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam chief of anti-Islamic conduct and political opportunism.

CBI raids AAP leader days after he was appointed as Gujarat polls co-in-chargeThe CBI raided AAP leader Durgesh Pathak's residence in connection with alleged violations of FCRA (Foreign Contribution Regulation Act). AAP slammed the BJP, claiming that it was afraid of its rise in Gujarat.

Indian-origin scientist discovers signs of alien life outside Solar SystemScientists have detected possible biosignature gases in the atmosphere of exoplanet K2-18 b -- gases produced only by life on Earth -- hinting at the presence of microbial life.

Watch: Neeraj Chopra begins 2025 season with winning throw at South Africa eventAhead of next month's Doha Diamond League, Neeraj Chopra competed in an invitational event in Potchefstroom, South Africa. Neeraj topped a six-man field with a best effort of 84.52m on Wednesday, April 16.

I was pilot when development took off, now Fadnavis flying it: Eknath ShindeMaharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde likened the Mahayuti government to a "development aircraft," saying he was its pilot with Fadnavis and Ajit Pawar as co-pilots.

BJP likely to get new chief by April-end as state-level polls conclude: SourcesSo far, 14 state presidents have been appointed, but as per the party's constitution, elections must be held in at least 19 states before the national presidential election can be conducted.

Tariffs capable of replacing income tax? Trump says there's a 'real chance'Drawing on historical precedent, Donald Trump argued that between 1870 and 1913, tariffs served as the primary source of government revenue and coincided with a period when the nation was "relatively the richest".

RJD leader pitches Tejashwi Yadav as chief ministerial face ahead of meet todayThe assertion comes despite Tejashwi Yadav saying that the face of the Mahagathbandhan would be decided amicably in consultation with alliance partners.

Kajol and Malaika Arora's heartwarming hug at Mumbai event wins InternetAt a recent Mumbai event, Bollywood stars Kajol and Malaika Arora shared a warm embrace, capturing the attention of fans and media alike. The duo's chemistry was the highlight of the evening, as fans couldn't stop gushing over the moment.

Cancer-stricken man kills wife, shoots himself in Ghaziabad, suicide note foundA cancer-stricken man shot dead his wife before turning the gun on himself in Ghaziabad. According to police, the victim left a suicide note saying he did not want to be a burden on his family to bear the cost of treating his cancer.

We will beat the hell out of you: Pakistan Army chief warns Baloch terroristsIn a spirited address, the army chief dismissed the idea that "1500 terrorists" could alter the course of the nation's future, promising a swift and forceful response.

Gensol Engineering shares hit 5% lower circuit for 2nd straight dayGensol Engineering share price: The stock plunged 5% to Rs 117.50 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), hitting yet another all-time low.

sports.headline: Jess Jonassen left out, Flintoff earns maiden Cricket Australia women's contractCricket Australia (CA) has unveiled its new 18-player women's national contract list for the 2025-26 season. Veteran all-rounder Jess Jonassen has been left out of the updated list.

NBA Play-in tournament: Heat dominate Bulls while Mavericks edge out KingsThe Dallas Mavericks and the Miami Heat kept their chances alive for the playoffs after winning their respective games on Wednesday night, April 16.

Hardik, Pollard have helped me stay calm under pressure: Naman DhirIPL 2025, MI vs SRH: In the pre-match press conference, Naman Dhir said that Hardik Pandya and Kieron Pollard have helped him learn the art of staying calm under pressure while batting at No.6 and 7.

Did RR choose wrong batters for Super Over? DC captain Axar Patel surprisedIPL 2025: Axar Patel revealed DC were prepared for Jaiswal in the Super Over and were surprised when RR didn't send him out. Their decision backfired, as Rahul and Stubbs sealed a smooth chase for DC.

BCCI sacks 4 support staff members after bad performance in Border–Gavaskar TrophyThe BCCI has removed four support staff members from the Indian cricket team following the 3-1 loss in the Border Gavaskar Trophy. Those removed include batting coach Abhishek Nair, fielding coach T Dilip, and strength and conditioning coach Soham Desai. This action comes amid reports of rifts within the team and concerns about discipline. The BCCI has not immediately announced replacements for the removed staff.

Credit to Starc but saliva makes a lot of difference: Nitish on Super Over lossRajasthan Royals batter Nitish Rana credited Mitchell Starc for his sensational 20th over but added that the return of saliva has made a massive difference to the game.

"We had our moments, but Starc was ice cold under pressure...to execute 11 out of the 12 yorkers he bowled perfectly at 145 Km/hr with the ball reversing, you have to give him the due credit", Rana said in the post match press conference.

Rajasthan Royals batter Nitish Rana credited Mitchell Starc for his sensational 20th over but added that the return of saliva had made a massive difference to the game.

Watch: DC's KL Rahul calls out Yashasvi Jaiswal's dismissal by Kuldeep YadavFrom calling Jaiswal's dismissal behind the stumps to anchoring the Super Over finish, KL Rahul's all-round game awareness proved decisive. His brilliance helped Delhi Capitals seal a thrilling win against Rajasthan Royals.

Axar Patel provides update on Kuldeep, praises Starc after DC win Super OverDelhi Capitals captain Axar Patel said that he was enjoying his leadership stint in IPL 2025 while providing update on Kuldeep Yadav's injury sustained during the Super Over win over Rajasthan Royals.

Dilip and strength and conditioning coach Soham Desai, from their roles after India's 1-3 series loss in Australia.

Nitish Rana breaks silence on Super Over snub vs DC: All decisions were rightDespite being RR's top performer with the bat, Nitish Rana stood by the management's call to send Riyan Parag and Shimron Hetmyer for the Super Over. RR's decisions in the key clash sparked criticism after DC clinched a tense win.

Watch: Hasan Ali apologises for 'King kar lega' remark to Babar AzamPakistan fast bowler Hasan Ali has apologised for his 'King Kar Lega' remark to Babar Azam in 2023. The fast bowler plays for Karachi Kings in the Pakistan Super League 2025.

Dilip and strength and conditioning coach Soham Desai, from their roles after India's 1-3 series loss in Australia.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
